definitions.title: n.pr.loc.
definitions.body: Babel, Babylon (in As. written Bab-ilu, gate of god Dl:Pa 212, cf. on other hand Jen:Kosmol. 498)—c. [[ה]]—[[ָ]] loc. [[בָּבֶ֫לָה]] Ez Eze 12:13 +, [[בָּבֶָלָה]] 2Ki 20:17 + once [[מִבָּבֶ֫לָה]] Je 27:16; —the ancient capital of Babylonia, mod. Hillah, situated on Euphrates, in long. c. 44° 30´ E., and lat. c. 320 50´ N.; Ge 10:10, Ge 11:9 (where name connected with [[בלל]] confuse, confound), both J, not elsewh. in Hex; 2Ki 17:24 + 31 t. 2 K; 18 t. Chr; Es 2:6; late Ps 87:4, Ps 137:1, Ps 137:8; Is:Is 2, Is:Is 3, viz. Is 13:1, Is 13:19, Is 14:4, Is 14:22, Is 21:9, Is 39:1, Is 39:3, Is 39:6, Is 39:7, Is 43:14, Is 47:1, Is 48:14, Is 48:20; Mic 4:10 (but here prob. not orig., cf. RS:Proph. vii. n. 5 & reff.) Zec 2:11, Zec 6:10, Da 1:1, Ez Eze 12:13 + 19 t. Ez; Je 20:4, Je 20:4, Je 20:5, Je 20:6 + 165 t. Je—note esp. ´[[אֶרֶץ בּ]] Je 50:28; also of land & people = realm, partic. in ´[[מֶלֶךְ בּ]] 2Ki 20:12 of Merodach Baladan; v:2Ki 20:18, 2Ki 24:1, 2Ki 24:7, 2Ki 24:11, 2Ki 24:12, 2Ki 24:12 + oft. of Nebuchadrezzar; 2Ki 25:27 = Je 52:31 cf. v:Je 52:34 of Evil-Merodach; Ne 13:6 of Artaxerxes; the city personif. as [[בַּת בָּבֶל]] Is 47:1, Je 50:42. (See Dl:Pa 212 COT Ge 11:9, KG:95.)
